publishedBibles.derived: Codex Vaticanus (according to the introduction in the reprint edition by S. F. Pells) of the Septuagint (but excluding the Apocrypha) and of the New Testament

translations.name: Thomson's Translation
translations.description: Charles Thomson's Translation of the Old Covenant is a the first translation of the Greek Septuagint into English. It was performed by Charles Thomson and published in 1808, taking in all 19 years to complete. The printer was Jane Aitken of Philadelphia. David Daniell, in his compendious work The Bible in English (2003), states that the scholars who worked on the Revised Version in England (1881) consulted Thomson's translations (among others, of course) during their work.
